scopecontent.p: Correspondence from 1941 between Max Bergmann and Baker and Co., Inc. The letters are in regards to the use of a new chemical, "Baker Colloid 46," by Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Ballentine, Robert, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding publication of his research 1941-43. Letters of recommendation, vita, application, interview, impressions of Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Ballentine, Robert, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Letters of recommendation, curriculum vitae, application, interview, impressions of Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Barger, George
scopecontent.p: Four telegrams concerning chemical equation of pyrimidine, Vit B, June 1936.

scopecontent.head: Barschall, Hermann
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from Max Bergmann to various labs trying to get Barschall (German refugee) a job.

scopecontent.head: Barus, Maxwell
scopecontent.p: Requests to Max Bergmann for information regarding a legal case. Bergmann refers Barus to other scientists.

scopecontent.head: Bass, Lawrence W.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning a speech at the New York section of the American Chemical Society in 1936.

scopecontent.head: Beadle, George Wells
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning a sample of l-serine needed for an experiment.

scopecontent.head: Beard, Howard H.
scopecontent.p: Letters regarding a paper and an experiment in which Beard seeks the advice of Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Beard, Joseph W.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Joseph Beard concerning an experiment.

scopecontent.head: Berger, William V.
scopecontent.p: Two letters from Max Bergmann to William Berger in regards to reprints and chemical samples for experiments.

scopecontent.head: Berggren, Ruth E. L.
scopecontent.p: Letter seeking employment in Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Berliner, Arnold
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Berliner regarding employment.

scopecontent.head: Bernheim, Frederick
scopecontent.p: General correspondence. Letters include details about an experiment and also the fate of an English scientist working under war conditions.

scopecontent.head: Behrens, Otto K.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Otto K. Behrens. Included are letters regarding Behrens working in Bergmann's lab for one year.

scopecontent.head: Beiser, Arthur
scopecontent.p: A copy of Beiser's curriculum vitae sent with a note to Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Benton, Arthur F.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding letters of recommendation for William Fenton Ross.

scopecontent.head: Bergmann, Max, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Includes: a list of reprints 1933-39, draft of a biographical sketch about Max Bergmann, written by Joseph S. Fruton for the American Academy of Science, mailing list for reprints, list of journals sent to Bergmann, and a list of membership to various societies.

scopecontent.head: Bergmann, Max, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Includes some personal and family correspondence. Also, a bibliography of Bergmann's articles, 1911-1925.

scopecontent.head: Bhagvat, Kamala
scopecontent.p: A note of thanks to Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Biochemical Society
scopecontent.p: Notices of meetings, nomination forms, receipts for payments of dues, and an inquiry from Max Bergmann regarding the terms of membership.

scopecontent.head: Biological Abstracts
scopecontent.p: Letters asking Max Bergmann to participate in abstracting articles.

scopecontent.head: Blackadder, T.
scopecontent.p: Letter from T. Blackadder (of Rohm and Hass Co.) to Max Bergmann, requesting samples of tanning materials.

scopecontent.head: Blank, Irvin H.
scopecontent.p: Notes of thanks to Max Bergmann regarding advice given.

scopecontent.head: Bloch, Henry S.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding job advice from Max Bergmann. Included is a copy of Henry Bloch's curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Bloch, Konrad, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Corresondence between Max Bergmann and Konrad Bloch. Letters are in regards to advice on gaining citizenship in the United States and concerns over the state of work within the field of science.

scopecontent.head: Bloch, Konrad, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Konrad Bloch's application to the "Relief and Research Fund Inc. N.Y." for a grant to do Ph.D. research under H.T. Clarke at Columbia University. Includes letters of recommendation from Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Block, Richard J.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Richard J. Block and Max Bergmann. Includes letters requesting reprints, advice on chemical experiments, and a note requesting that Max Bergmann comment on a paper of Block's.

scopecontent.head: Blumenthal, Fritz
scopecontent.p: A letter informing Max Bergmann of Blumenthal's intentions to take the U.S. Medical Board examinations.

scopecontent.head: Boas, Franz
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Franz Boas and Max Bergmann. Letters inform Bergmann of Boas intentions to set up a Palestine Science Society for Jewish Scientists in Europe. Includes a list of scholars with sympathy to the cause.

scopecontent.head: Bolton, E. K.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between E. K. Bolton (of DuPont Nemours Co.) and Max Bergmann. Included are requests for a sample of dyes for experimental purposes, and also a note congratulating Bergmann on his recent move to the Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: Book Order
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous material relating to book orders. Includes catalogs, book orders, and reciepts of payment.

scopecontent.head: Bookbinders
scopecontent.p: Reciepts of payment to "Knoll's Bookbindery."

scopecontent.head: Borsook, H.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding a speech given by Borsook at the Rockefeller Institute on September 24, 1941.

scopecontent.head: Boston Hide and Leather Company
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the recommendation of a leather chemist.

scopecontent.head: Boyd, George Edward
scopecontent.p: Letter requesting polypeptides for an experiment.

scopecontent.head: Brand, Erwin
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Erwin Brand and Max Bergmann. Includes letters regarding the American Chemical Society, Brand's work, and also letters in regards to the exchange of both chemicals and equipment between Bergmann and Brand.

scopecontent.head: Brand, Hugo
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the employment for a German refugee leather chemist.

scopecontent.head: Braunschweig, Theodore
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Braunschweig's application to the American Leather Chemist Association.

scopecontent.head: Brenner, Carl Max
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Brenner's appointment to work for one year in Max Bergmann's lab and the arrangements for his arrival.

did.unittitle: British Association for the Advancement of Science

scopecontent.head: British Association for the Advancement of Science
scopecontent.p: Invitations to meetings.

scopecontent.head: Buchman, Edwin R.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the presence of vitamin B in protein hydrolysate.

scopecontent.head: Bueding, Ernest
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence between Ernest Bueding and Max Bergmann. Letters linclude request for papain to A. K. Balls and the recommendation of Bueding to th American Society of Biological Chemists.

scopecontent.head: C - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence. Includes invitations to meetings, inquiries for chemicals, recommendation for a Bruno R. Roberts, short biographical sketch of Hermann J. Muller.

scopecontent.head: C- Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence. Includes a reference for Sydney W. Fox, notes of thanks to and from Max Bergmann regarding reprints. Letter on how to hydroginate carbobenzoxy compounds. Letter from Dr. Calvert, a Spanish war scientist and refugee, seeking help from Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: C - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence. Includes a note from Chemical Publishing Co., a recommendation for Dora Stern to the Chemists Club of N.Y., and a note of thanks and recommendation of Calvin Gloumbic to Max Bergmann. Request for information on the manufacture and preparation of papain from a Dr. Chatelier. Notice of Bergmann's membership to the London Chemical Society. Invitation to the meeting of the Washington section of the American Chemical Society. A request for Bergmann to serve on a Protein Committee for NRC from William Clarke. A letter from the American Bureau for Medical Aid to China seeking medical supplies.

scopecontent.head: C - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence. Includes addresses of agencies to aid refugees with names of administrators. Dinner invitations. A letter of recommendation of a Mrs. Marion Coomber written by Joseph Fruton. A copy of a letter to Albert Einstein from the "Coatwise Petroleum Company" regarding a reference given by Einstein and Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: C - Misc., No. 5
scopecontent.p: Invitation to a symposium on "The Struggle for Economic Security in Democracy." Request to Max Bergmann for Chulmoogra seeds. Program for Temperature Symposium at Cornell University. Request for a catalouge of pyrex glassware. A letter of recommendation for Felix Heinemann.

scopecontent.head: C - Misc., No. 6
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence. Includes a request for a meeting to discuss o-nitrophenols from George Cronheim of G.F. Harvey Co., and a government job description for chief chemist and chemical engineer.

scopecontent.head: Cahnmann, Hans J.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning employment for Chanmann. Letters from Cahnmann to Bergmann are in handwritten German.

scopecontent.head: Calvery, Herbert O.
scopecontent.p: Informal letters concerning chemicals, job recommendations, and plans for Calvery's visit to New York.

scopecontent.head: Campbell, Editha C.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Editha C. Campbell (of the Publishing Division of the Rockefeller Institute), regarding where and how often to list and publish material.

scopecontent.head: Canadian Review of Biology
scopecontent.p: Invitation for Max Bergmann to join the "Comite de Collaboration Scientifique."

scopecontent.head: Cannan, R. Keith
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between R. Keith Cannan (President of the Harvey Society) and Max Bergmann. Letters include: the appointment of Bergmann to the Harvey Society, notes of congratulations, requests for reprints, notes concerning different chemicals, and a speech given by Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Cantoni, Giulio
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, between Max Bergmann and Italian refugee Giulio Cantoni, concerning his chances of employment in the United States. Included is Cantoni's curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Carbide & Carbon Chemicals Corp.
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting chemicals. Receipts of purchase.

scopecontent.head: Carpenter, Samuel C., Jr., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence pertaining to the employment of Samuel C. Carpenter Jr. Includes several letters of recommendation from Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Carpenter, Samuel C., Jr., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Carter, Herbert E.
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting chemicals and reprints.

scopecontent.head: Carter, Neal M.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Catalogs
scopecontent.p: Two catalogs: "Barcroft-Warburg Apparatus & Glassware," and "Orthmann Laboratories, Inc."

scopecontent.head: Cattell, Jaques
scopecontent.p: Contains three letters concerning the reviewing by Max Bergmann for the journal "Science." The last letter in the correspondence is from Bergmann's secretary to Cattell informing him of Bergmann's death. Also included is a copy of Bergmann's review of "Optical Activity and Living Matter," by G.F. Gause, published in "Science" on June 30, 1944.

scopecontent.head: Cattell, James McKeen
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning Max Bergmann's work on the review board of "Science," articles written by Bergmann, and personal correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Chargaff, Erwin
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding different chemicals. Also, a questionnaire needed for Chargaff to be employed with the U.S. War Production Program.

scopecontent.head: Chemical Rubber Corp.
scopecontent.p: Orders placed for lab apparatus by Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Chibnall, A. Charles, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning Chibnall's visits to the lab at the Rockefeller Institute in September and November 1938.

scopecontent.head: Chibnall, A. Charles
scopecontent.p: Rough notes about Chibnall and his publications for his upcoming lecture at the Rockefeller Institute. Diagram's for Chibnall's talk.

scopecontent.head: Chibnall, A. Charles, No. 3
scopecontent.p: Copy of Chibnall's "Bakerian Lecture" delivered July 16, 1942.

scopecontent.head: Chou, Chiyuan, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Personal and professional correspondence. Includes letters about Chou's initial visit to New York and his employment in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Chou, Chiyuan, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence to Max Bergmann and other lab members at the Rockefeller Institute including Christmas cards, and wedding announcements.

scopecontent.head: Chou, Edith J. H.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding a voluteer position in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Christensen, Halvor N.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding a manuscript sent to Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Ciereszko, Leon Stanley
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding a job at Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Clark, W. Mansfield
scopecontent.p: Manuscript sent to Clark. Describes a method developed in Max Bergmann's lab on the measurement of solubility on a semi-micro scale.

scopecontent.head: Clarke, Hans Thatcher, No. 1
scopecontent.p: General and personal correspondence. Includes: letters of thanks for reprints, letters of recommendation for Conrad Bloch by Max Bergmann to Clarke, also Heinrich Waelsch, Chiyuan Chou and Heinz Fraenkel-Conrat, and a recommendation by Clarke for Joseph Fruton to the American Society of Biological Chemists. Various invitations to dinners and meetings. Some analyses from Herman Fischer sent to Clarkes lab.

scopecontent.head: Clarke, Hans Thatcher, No. 2
scopecontent.p: General Correspondence. Letter inviting Clarke to speak at the Rockefeller Institute. Several letters of recommendation written by Clarke and Max Bergmann. Inquiries from Bergmann to Clarke in regards to finding someone to work in his lab. A letter asking Bergmann to give comments on a recent manuscript written by Clarke to be published in the "Journal of Biological Chemistry."

scopecontent.head: Clowes, George H. A.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and George H. A. Clowes (of the Lilly Research Laboratories). Letter of recommendation for a protein chemist from Bergmann to Clowes. Letter concerning a special type of insulin given by Lilly Co. to Bergmann for his research.

scopecontent.head: Cohen, Joseph H.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the invitation of Max Bergmann to be a guest at the New Century Club of Boston.

scopecontent.head: Cohn, Alfred Einstein
scopecontent.p: General correspondence. A letter informing Cohn of his appointment to the "Rockefeller Institute Committee of the Staff Meetings."

scopecontent.head: Cohn, Edwin J., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding protein samples.

scopecontent.head: Cohn, Edwin J., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence. Letters regarding chemicals. A request by Cohn to Bergmann for more information on Sidney W. Fox. Invitations to speak at Harvard and the Rockefeller Institute both to and from Max Bergmann. Letters describing the state of work in both Bergmann and Cohn's labs.

scopecontent.head: Columbia University
scopecontent.p: A letter seeking information regarding University classes. Invitations to two lectures: November, 1939 and February, 1942.

scopecontent.head: Commercial Solvents Corporation
scopecontent.p: Advertisements, requests for chemicals, and receipts of payment.

scopecontent.head: Committee on Carbohydrate Nomenclature of the ACS
scopecontent.p: Revised memorandum and the "Final Report" given to the Committee on Carbohydrate Nomenclature.

scopecontent.head: Connolly, Nora
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Nora Connolly. Includes a note of well wishes to Bergmann during his illness.

did.unittitle: Corn Exchange Bank Trust Co., New York.

scopecontent.head: Corn Exchange Bank Trust Company
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning accounts and statements.

scopecontent.head: Coutts & Company
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Max Bergmann's subscription to "The Chemical Society of London."

scopecontent.head: Corxatto, H
scopecontent.p: Requests for chemicals from Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Cruz-Coke, E.
scopecontent.p: Letter discussing kidney enzymes and dehydrogenated peptides.

scopecontent.head: Curme, George O.
scopecontent.p: Congratulatory notes from Max Bergmann to Curme on his elction to the National Academy of Sciences and his recent award of a William Gibbs Medal.

scopecontent.head: Curtis Publishing Company
scopecontent.p: Receipts of payment.

scopecontent.head: D - Misc., No. 1-5
scopecontent.p: General materials from August 10, 1934- October 15, 1945. Approximately 200 pp.

scopecontent.head: D - Misc., No. 1-5
scopecontent.p: General materials from August 10, 1934- October 15, 1945. Approximately 200 pp.

scopecontent.head: D - Misc., No. 1-5
scopecontent.p: General materials from August 10, 1934- October 15, 1945. Approximately 200 pp.

scopecontent.head: D - Misc., No. 1-5
scopecontent.p: General materials from August 10, 1934- October 15, 1945. Approximately 200 pp.

scopecontent.head: D - Misc., No. 1-5
scopecontent.p: General materials from August 10, 1934- October 15, 1945. Approximately 200 pp.

scopecontent.head: Da Fano, Ettore
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Da Fano and Max Bergmann concerning employment for Da Fano. Included are copies of Da Fano's curriculum vitae, resume, and a summary of his life.

scopecontent.head: Dakin, Henry D., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Dakin.

scopecontent.head: Dakin, Henry D., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Henry Dakin.

scopecontent.head: Dakin, Henry D., No. 3
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Henry Dakin.

scopecontent.head: Daniel, Ruth Ortmann
scopecontent.p: Curriculum vitae and references.

scopecontent.head: Degering, E. F.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and E. F. Degering. Requests for Bergmann to tour the Mid-Western Co-operating sections of the American Chemical Society.

scopecontent.head: Demerec, Milislav
scopecontent.p: Request for Max Bergmann to take part in the Cold Spring Harbor Symposium in the summer of 1941.

scopecontent.head: Demonstrations
scopecontent.p: List of outlines for demonstrations given by Bergmann at his lab.

scopecontent.head: Demuth, F.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning job placement for refugees. Includes several curriculum vitae and letters of recommendation.

scopecontent.head: Dictionary of Biochemistry
scopecontent.p: Advertisements announcing the publication of the Dictionary of Biochemistry.

scopecontent.head: Doherty, David
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and David Doherty. Includes a letter of recommendation for Doherty to the Office of Naval Officer Procurement.

scopecontent.head: Donnan, Frederick George
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning Max Bergmann's appointment to the Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: Drury, Betty
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Betty Drury (Executive Secretary of the Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars). Letters concern job placement for refugees.

scopecontent.head: Dubos, Rene Jules
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Rene Dubos. Includes a congratulatory note from Bergmann to Dubos on his appointment as a member of the Rockefeller Institute. Other letters discuss the substance gramicidin.

scopecontent.head: Dunn, M. S., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Dunn regarding methods of isolating glycine, alanine, and serine. Includes a detailed description of the process written by Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Dunn, M. S., No. 2
scopecontent.p: A letter of recommendation to Max Bergmann from Dunn regarding the nomination of Sidney Fox to the American Society of Biological Chemists. Other letters discuss Bergmann's work with phenylhydrazine and histidine.

scopecontent.head: Duschinsky, Robert
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Robert Duschinsky. Letters include notes of thanks for reprints, Duschinsky's application for a post at Bergmann's lab, and several letters discussing the plight of German refugees.

scopecontent.head: du Vigneaud, Vincent, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Recommendation to Max Bergmann of Dr. Loring and a list of Loring's publications. Information on chemicals and preparation of chemicals. Letters about filling positions at the Rockefeller Institute and George Washington University. Invitations to Bergmann for meetings.

scopecontent.head: du Vigneaud, Vincent, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence. Includes dinner invitations, letters about experiments, and the exchange of reprints.

scopecontent.head: E - Misc., No.1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. Letter discussing plans for vacation and also a program for the ceremonial cornerstone laying of the Eastern Regional Research Laboratory in Wyndmoor, Pa., including a map and transit routes of the area.

scopecontent.head: E - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. Includes a letter of recommendation written by Bergmann, requests for reprints, and personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Robert Ehrmann.

scopecontent.head: E - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Includes request for reprints, letters of recommendation, and letters discussing experiments.

scopecontent.head: E - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. Includes letters of recommendation for: Freidrich Phillip Ellinger (curriculum vitae included), Chi yuan-Chou, Gabriel Kitzinger, Heinz Fraenkel-Conrat. Other materials consist of invitations to dinner and requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: E - Misc., No. 5
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. An invitation to speak at the Johns Hopkins University Research Conference. Also a recommendation written to the Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Physicians on behalf of Heinz Fraenkl-Conrat.

scopecontent.head: Eastman Kodak Company, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Request for catalogs by Max Bergmann, reciepts of payment, requests for reprints, and letters of apology for delay of supplies.

scopecontent.head: Eastman Kodak Company, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Letters from Max Bergmann requesting chemicals, cameras, and information about articles printed by the Eastman Kodak Company.

scopecontent.head: Edlbacher, S.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding employment for Edlbacher.

scopecontent.head: Egloff, Gustav
scopecontent.p: A copy of an article titled "Germany Committs Scientific Suicide" sent to Max Bergmann for his comments.

scopecontent.head: Eimer & Amend
scopecontent.p: Supply slips for apparatus and chemicals, orders, and general inquiries.

scopecontent.head: Einstein, Albert
scopecontent.p: A letter from Albert Einstein to Max Bergmann requesting the recommendation of a chemist for his lab.

scopecontent.head: Eisendrath, David B.
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and David Eisendrath. Includes notes of well wishes, notes of thanks, and dinner invitations.

scopecontent.head: Eisenstein, Alfred
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Alfred Eisenstein.

scopecontent.head: Elderfield, Robert C.
scopecontent.p: Letters from Max Bergmann to Elderfield declining invitations to speak at conferences.

scopecontent.head: Ellern, Herbert
scopecontent.p: Curriculum vitae, resume, and photograph.

scopecontent.head: Elman, Robert, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Robert Elman. Letters discuss technical problems of Elman's work and arrangements for visits to Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Elman, Robert, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Robert Elman. Includes notes of thanks, Bergmann's comments on a paper written by Elman, and a discussion concerning the situation of Dr. Fritz Lieben (curriculum vitae included).

did.unittitle: Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars

scopecontent.head: Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and the Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars. Letters are in regards to the recommendation of refugees to and from Bergmann and the Committee. Includes recommendations for: Karl Schon (curriculum vitae included), Otto Schwartzkopff, Hans M. Cassel (curriculum vitae included), Dr. Moritz Kohn, and Ruth B. Neufield-Crzellitzer (curriculum vitae included).

scopecontent.head: Emery, Alden H.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning meetings of the American Chemical Society. Includes invitations for Max Bergmann to speak and do a lecture tour.

scopecontent.head: Engelhardt, W. A.
scopecontent.p: Reprint of an article titled "Enzymatic and Mechanical Properties of Muscle Proteins."

scopecontent.head: F - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous files. Includes invitations to speaking engagements and letters of recommendation.

scopecontent.head: F - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous files. Includes correspondence regarding chemical samples, experiments, letters of recommendation, and invitations to speaking engagements.

scopecontent.head: F - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous files. Includes correspondence regarding the situation of Dr. Otto Meyerhoff in Heidelberg, Germany.

scopecontent.head: F - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous files. Includes correspondence regarding chemicals, experiments, dinner invitations, and notes of thanks.

scopecontent.head: F - Misc., No. 5
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous files. Includes correspondence regarding invitations, requests for reprints, notes of thanks, and letters of recommendation. Letters pertaining to Bergmann's illness. A Western Union telegram from Joseph Fruton informing Heinz Fraenkel-Conrat of Bergmann's death. Correspondence between Bergmann and Walter Frankford discussing Bergmann's "iron tannage" process and also Bergmann's thoughts on the war in Europe.

scopecontent.head: Fairchild, David
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and David Fairchild regarding experiments and methods.

scopecontent.head: Fajans, Kasimir
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the recommendation of possible students from Max Bergmann to Kasimir Fajans.

scopecontent.head: Federal Bureau of Investigation
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and the Federal Bureau of Investigation concerning mail sent to Bergmann from Germany.

did.unittitle: Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology

scopecontent.head: Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology
scopecontent.p: Circular to members and programs of meetings.

scopecontent.head: Feibelmann, Richard
scopecontent.p: Letters of recommendation from Max Bergmann to Richard Feibelmann. Bergmann writes to Feibelmann on behalf of recently arrived German refugees.

scopecontent.head: Feigl, Fritz
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Fritz Feigl. Feigl writes to Bergmann to discuss the position of Dr. Moritz Kohn. Letters discussin Feigl's son attending college in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Feuchtwanger, Marie-Louise
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Fingermann, Steffi
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Fink, Robert M.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the possibility of Fink working for one year in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Fire Extinguisher
scopecontent.p: Hand written and typed copies of a "Report on CO2 Extinguisher Demonstration."

scopecontent.head: Fischer, Herman O. L., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Herman Fischer. Letters concern various experiments, exchange of papers, and arrangements for lectures to be given by both Bergmann and Fischer. One letter discusses the efforts to free a Professor Friedrich Epstein out of a concentration camp in southern France.

scopecontent.head: Fischer, Herman O. L., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Herman Fischer. Letters discussing the coming war in Europe and the implications it will have on the future. Letters regarding job prospects for German refugees and how to get a Professor Strauss out of Germany. Letters about Bergmann's efforts to get a paper of Mendel's and Fischer's published in "Science." Note of reprints sent to Fischer.

scopecontent.head: Flaschner, Erich
scopecontent.p: Letter to Max Bergmann from Erich Flaschner (leather chemist and German refugee residing in London) regarding job prospects in the United States. Includes a copy of Flaschner's curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Flexner, Simon
scopecontent.p: General progress report of the analysis of progestin. Letters of thanks for reprints from both Max Bergmann and Simon Flexner.

scopecontent.head: Flinn, Waldo R., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Letters showing the forwarding of job applications. Notes on the vacation policy of the Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: Flinn, Waldo R., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Administrative information and policies of the Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: Foa, Piero
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment. Includes copies of both Dr. Piero Foa's and his father Dr. Carlos Foa's curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Fordham University
scopecontent.p: Invitations to meetings.

scopecontent.head: Fox, Sidney W., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Sidney Fox. Congratulatory notes to Fox on the birth of his son and on becoming an assistant professor at the University of Iowa. Requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Fox, Sidney W., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Letters from Fox informing Max Bergmann of his progress, jobs, and whereabouts.

scopecontent.head: Fraenkel-Conrat, Heinz
scopecontent.p: Summary of an experiment sent by Fraenkel-Conrat to the Journal of the American Chemical Society. Letters asking for Max Bergmann's advice over preparation of chemical compounds. Notes of thanks to Bergmann for job recommendations and his assistance in Fraenkel-Conrat recieving his naturalization papers. Letters to Bergmann informing him of Fraenkel-Conrat's job changes.

scopecontent.head: Fraenkel-Conrat, Heinz, No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Heinz Fraenkel-Conrat. Letters regarding the naturalization of Fraenkel-Conrat. Letters concerning employment. Letters of recommendation. Copy of Fraenkel-Conrat's curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Freudenberg, Walter
scopecontent.p: Discussion of a method to treat leather with salt resulting in "salzstippen" leather.

scopecontent.head: Freundlich, Herbert
scopecontent.p: Letters in reference to finding a job in the United States for Dr. Marie Wrescher.

scopecontent.head: Frey, Ralph W.
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting a sample of salzstippen leather. Letters to Max Bergmann explaining Frey's work with leather. Letters requesting the chemical phosgene.

scopecontent.head: Fried, Josef
scopecontent.p: Letters from Josef Fried (German refugee) to Max Bergmann concerning employment.

scopecontent.head: Friedberg, A. E.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the delivery of cigars to Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Fruton, Joseph S., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Joseph S. Fruton. Inlcudes notes about demonstrations Fruton has to give at his lab.

scopecontent.head: Fruton, Joseph S., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence. Work reports both to and from Max Bergmann and Joseph S. Fruton when both were on vacation. Requests for reprints. Fruton's curriculum vitae and bibliography up to 1942. Copy of a talk given by Max Bergmann on the occasion of Fruton being given the Eli Lilly Award in 1944. Speech given by Fruton at Bergmann's funeral.

scopecontent.head: Fruton, Joseph S., No. 3
scopecontent.p: Talk given at a staff meeting.

scopecontent.head: Fuchs, Karl
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment. A copy of Fuchs' curriculum vitae included.

scopecontent.head: Fuchs, Margaret U.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment. A copy of Fuchs' curriculum vitae included.

scopecontent.head: G - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials.

scopecontent.head: G - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. Letters requesting reprints. Letter from Max Bergmann requesting a sample of Rhamnose. A newspaper article dated August 20, 1944, titled "Can the Germans Cure Themselves?"

scopecontent.head: G - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. A letter of recommendation for Gertrude Glauber. References to other letters in the collection.

scopecontent.head: G - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material. Letters of inroduction. Requests and thanks for reprints. Invitations to speak at conferences.

scopecontent.head: G - Misc., No. 5
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous material. Letter to Adoph Grun in Swtizerland acknowledging that Max Bergmann had recieved his letter concerning a Dr. Brenner in Zurich and will accept Brenner in his lab for one year. Abstract of a lecture given by Bergmann titled, "Structure of Proteins in Relation to Biological Problems."

scopecontent.head: Gallay, W.
scopecontent.p: Letters to Max Bergmann thanking him for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Gasser, Herbert S., #1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergman and Herbert S. Gasser (Director of the Rockefeller Institute). Invitations to dinner. Request for Bergmann's annual lab report. Notices of Institute meetings. Notes to Gasser from Bergmann regarding students working in his lab, including: William H. Stein, Paul Zamecnik, Robert Ballentine, E. Silva Roche, Mark A. Stahmann, and Calvin Golumbic. Notices of F. Goebel and Rene Dubois becoming members of the Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: Gasser, Herbert S., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Herbert S. Gasser (Director of the Rockefeller Institute).

scopecontent.head: Gilman, Henry
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Henry Gilman. Includes letters of recommendation and Bergmann's comments on chapters written by Gilman.

scopecontent.head: Glaser, Elizabeth B.
scopecontent.p: Application for a job in Max Bergmann's lab. Includes a cover letter, resume, transcripts, letters of recommendation, and a photograph.

scopecontent.head: Glasser, Otto
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Otto Glaser concerning Bergmann's contribution to a book.

scopecontent.head: Glick, David
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning problems with an experiment. Includes a curriculum vitae and publications list for David Glick.

scopecontent.head: Globus, Joseph H.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the reprinting of an article written by Globus and max Bergmann in the "Journal of the Mount Sinai Hospital."

scopecontent.head: Goepp, R. Max, Jr.
scopecontent.p: Letters seeking the advice of Max Bergmann for a commemorative meeting to be held in St. Louis for Emil Fischer.

scopecontent.head: Goldberg, Joseph L.
scopecontent.p: Letters asking Max Bergmann to write a recommendation for Goldberg.

scopecontent.head: Goldschimiedt, Henry
scopecontent.p: Letters asking Max Bergmann to join as an honorary member of the American Society of European Chemists and Pharmacists. Includes several pamphlets and programs for group meetings.

scopecontent.head: Goldstein, Kurt
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Kurt Goldstein in regards to refugee scientists. A letter from Bergmann concerning advice about to prospective refugees, Dr. V. Kaffka and Dr. Else Hirschberg, both about to be interned in Germany if not helped. A letter regarding an opening for two female refugees.

scopecontent.head: Gray, Phillip P.
scopecontent.p: Letter about a sample of pepsin sent to Gray from Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Greenberg, David M.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and David Greenberg. Includes letters regarding experiments and requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Greenstein, Jesse P., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Jesse P. Greenstein. Letters pertaining to reprints and samples of chemicals from Bergmann. Includes letters of recommendation written for Greenstein by Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Greenstein, Jesse P., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Jesse P. Greenstein.

scopecontent.head: Growth Society of Lankenau Hospital
scopecontent.p: The editors from the journal "Growth" write to Max Bergmann requesting an article.

scopecontent.head: Guggenheim, M.
scopecontent.p: A letter announcing Max Bergmann's employment at the Rockefeller Institute. Letters regarding the purchase of various chemicals for experiments. Requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Gustavson, K. H.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Gustavson. Letters discuss the technical aspects of Gustavson's work with Max Bergmann. Requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Gutfeld, Fritz J. von
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning the employment of Fritz J. von Gutfeld. Includes letters of recommendation from Max Bergmann and a curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Gyorgy, Paul
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the search for young chemists to fill various positions at Gyorgy's lab.

scopecontent.head: H - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material.

scopecontent.head: H - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material.

scopecontent.head: H - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material.

scopecontent.head: H - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material.

scopecontent.head: H - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous material.

scopecontent.head: Haas, Otto H.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Otto Haas. Letter asking Bergmann to be a consultant for Rohm and Haas Co. A leather sample sent from Haas to Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Hack, Marvin H.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning chemicals wanted by Hack.

scopecontent.head: Hale, D. R.
scopecontent.p: A letter of introduction for Miss Florence Edel.

scopecontent.head: Halliday, Nellie
scopecontent.p: Request for information on certain types of production for chemicals. Requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Hanson, Frank Blair
scopecontent.p: Information to Max Bergmann regarding the reciepts of fellowships by students that will be under his instruction.

scopecontent.head: Harrington, C. R.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Harrington. Letters regarding Harrington's work at the University College Hospital Medical School at the University of London. A letter from Bergmann to Harrington introducing Carl Niemann. An invitation to meeting at the British Association for the Advancement of Science.

scopecontent.head: Harrow, Benjamin
scopecontent.p: Requets for Max Bergman's reprints. A letter from Harrow asking Bergman and Joseph Fruton to review chapters of a new book. A letter from Bergmann to Harrow recommending Joseph I. Goldberger for a job.

scopecontent.head: Harte, Robert A.
scopecontent.p: Request for reprints. A letter inviting Max Bergmann to address the Metropolitan Microchemical Society.

scopecontent.head: Harvey, Alexander
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning reprints.

scopecontent.head: Harvey Society
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials concerning the Harvey Society. Includes invitations to meetings, yearly schedules, and lecture cards.

scopecontent.head: Haugaard, Gotfred, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Letters form max Bergmann informing Haugaard that he can come to work in Bergmann's lab on a Rockefeller Scholarship. Letters regarding the arrangements of his arrival. Letter of recommendation from Lindestrom-Lang of the Carlsberg Lab.

scopecontent.head: Haugaard, Gotfred, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence informing Max Bergmann of Haugaard's progress and whereabouts after leaving Bergmann's lab. Biographical data about Haugaard, including his bibliography to 1941. A letter from Haugaard to Bergmann seeking advice on how to find permanent employment in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Haurowitz, Felix
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Haurowitz. Haurowitz writes from Istanbul seeking advice from Bergmann on a move to the United States.

scopecontent.head: Hayden, Phillip M.
scopecontent.p: Letters of recommendation written by Max Bergmann to Phillip Hayden at Columbia University.

scopecontent.head: Heidelberger, Michael
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Michael Heidelberger. Letter from Heidelberger and his son Charles to Max Bergmann in regards to a job in Bergmann's lab. Includes a letter from Charles Heidelberger informing Bergmann of his regrets in turning down a position in his lab. A letter of recommendation for Manfred Mayer from Michael Heidelberger to Max Bergman.

scopecontent.head: Hellerman, Leslie
scopecontent.p: Requests for reprints from Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Hess, Walter C.
scopecontent.p: Questions concerning figures in one of Max Bergmann's articles.

scopecontent.head: Heymann, Karl
scopecontent.p: A letter of recommendation written by Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Hibbert, Harold, No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between max Bergmann and Harold Hibbert. Hibbert seeks advice Bergmann on how to make a digestable membrane sheath to be used in surgery.

scopecontent.head: Hibbert, Harold, No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Harold Hibbert. Letter from Hibbert to Bergmann recommending a Dr. Herzog who is looking to leave Germany and find employment in the United States. A letter discussing the suicide of Herzog. Letters of recommendation from Hibbert regarding Dr. Saul Trister and W. Lincoln Hawkins. Letters of recommendation from Bergmann regarding Miss Vilma Prochaunick and Herbert Ellern-Eichmann.

scopecontent.head: Highburger, John H.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and John Highburger. Invitations to dinner. Letters regarding technical advice and information about experiments.

scopecontent.head: Hirschberg, Else
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning a job for Hirschberg in the United States. Curriculum vitae included.

scopecontent.head: Hirschwaldsche Buchhandlung
scopecontent.p: Book distributors in Germany. Letters from Bergmann requesting articles.

scopecontent.head: Hixon, R. M.
scopecontent.p: Bergmann writes to Hixon looking for a young chemist to work at the Rockefeller Institute under him.

scopecontent.head: Hoffmann-LaRoche, Inc.
scopecontent.p: Reprints, catalogs of chemicals for sale. Letters of recommendation from Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Hofmann, Klaus
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Klaus Hofmann. Letters of recommendation for Hoffmann. Letters concerning Hofmann's work as a fellow at the Rockefeller Institute. Postcards to Bergmann from Hoffmann.

scopecontent.head: Hornicek, Frank
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Frank Hornicek. Letters discuss the war effort at home and abroad. Bergmann sends letters of well wishes and cigars. Hornicek writes to Bergmann informing him of his progress in basic training and then in combat.

scopecontent.head: Horsfall, Frank L.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Frank Horsfall. Letter informing Max Bergmann of his appointment to the Committee of the Staff Meetings of the Rockefeller Institute. Letters regarding staff meetings. A note of thanks for equipment lent by Bergmann to Horsfall.

scopecontent.head: Hotchkiss, Rollin D.
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting reprints.

scopecontent.head: Hotels
scopecontent.p: General correspondence regarding hotel reservations and conferences.

scopecontent.head: Howard, Curt G.
scopecontent.p: Letters from Howard to Max Bergmann seeking advice on finding a job.

scopecontent.head: Hunter, Andrew
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning analytical work and requests for chemicals.

scopecontent.head: Hurd, Charles D.
scopecontent.p: Max Bergmann writes requesting reports on the work of the Committee on Carbohydrate Nomenclature of the American Chemical Society. Letters from Bergmann to Hurd concerning the need for young chemists available to work in his lab.

scopecontent.head: I - Misc.
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials.

scopecontent.head: Ignatieff, V.
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting Max Bergmann's reprints.

scopecontent.head: Ing, Harold R.
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning arrangements to work in Max Bergamnn's lab. A letter accepting a Rockefeller Institute scholarship.

scopecontent.head: Institute of Leather Manufacture Research
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting reprints. Includes a copy of "Technology of the Tanning Extract Manufacture," written by M. I. Haydyk.

scopecontent.head: International Physiological Congress
scopecontent.p: Notices of meetings and brochures for the International Physiological Conference held in the Soviet Union and Switzerland.

scopecontent.head: Interscience Publishers Incorporated
scopecontent.p: General correspondence. Business letters, returning and reprinting of proofs, copies of reprints sent to Max Bergmann, book lists, and bills.

scopecontent.head: Invitations
scopecontent.p: Invitations to events including handwritten notes of "accepted" or "declined."

scopecontent.head: Irving, George W., Jr.
scopecontent.p: Informal letters about Irving's move to New Orleans. A note about Otto Loewy's son, a refugee residing in Peru who may get a visa to the United States, Max Bergmann asks if Irving will be of some help when he passes through New Orleans.

scopecontent.head: Isabell, Horace S.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Horace Isabell concerning a speech given by Max Bergmann to the Washington Section of the American Chemical Society. Letters asking Bergmann to read an article and a manuscript written by Isabell.

did.unittitle: Isolation of P-Serine From Silk Fibroins

scopecontent.head: Isolation of P-Serine From Silk Fibroins
scopecontent.p: Driections for the Isolation of P-Serine From Silk Fibroins.

scopecontent.head: J - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Letters requesting reprints and chemical samples. Curriculum vitae of Lillian Ann Jedeikin.

scopecontent.head: J - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Letters discussing experiements, requests for reprints, and letters regarding positions in Max Bergmann's lab. Letter of recommendation written by Bergmann for Jesse P. Greenstein.

scopecontent.head: Jablonski, Ludwig
scopecontent.p: Letters to Max Bergmann concerning employment in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Jackson, Richard W.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Richard Jackson. Letters discussing the organization of the protein Division of the Eastern Regional Research Labs. Requests for reprints. Bergmann writes to Jackson requesting information on David Doherty. A letter of recommendation for Dr. Emil L. Smith for an opening in Jackson's lab.

scopecontent.head: Jacobs, Walter A.
scopecontent.p: Bibliography of Walter A. Jacobs from 1906 - 1945

scopecontent.head: Jacoby, Kurt
scopecontent.p: Letter from Max Bergmann vouching for Jacoby's charachter when he applies for a United States visa. Invitation to dinner at a publishing house.

scopecontent.head: Jambor, Nikolaus
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Nikolaus Jambour.

scopecontent.head: Jameson, Eloise
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dinner when Max Bergmann attends a Stanford University meeting.

scopecontent.head: Janeway Lecture
scopecontent.p: Copy of the Edward Gamaliel Janeway Lecture, delivered by Max Bergmann at the Mount Sinai Hospital on May 16, 1939. The lecture is titled, "Some Biological Aspects of Protein Chemists."

scopecontent.head: Jewish Organizations
scopecontent.p: Invitations to meetings and dinners for many Jewish Societies including the Federation of Jewish Charities, the United Jewish Appeal, and the American Jewish Committee.

scopecontent.head: Johns Hopkins University
scopecontent.p: Announcements for the "Johns Hopkins University Annual Research Conference." A letter of recommendation written by Max Bergmann on behalf of Dr. Alfred Reis. Letters from the New School for Social Research asking for a reference for Dr. Paul Erculisse.

scopecontent.head: Johnson, Walter, J.
scopecontent.p: A book dealer who Max Bergmann sells his used books. Later correspondence with between Johnson and Bergmann's secretary after his death.

scopecontent.head: Joseph, Rosalind
scopecontent.p: Copy of a speech given by Max Bergmann at a party in honor of Rosalind Joseph.

scopecontent.head: Jordan Lloyd, Dorothy
scopecontent.p: General correspondence. Requests for reprints. General notes of thanks. Letters concerning Lloyd's visit to Max Bergmann's lab on behalf of the British Leather Chemical Association.

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry.

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry.

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 3
scopecontent.p: Max Bergmann's notes, analysis, and critiques of papers submitted to the Journal of Biological Chemistry.

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 4
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry. Includes a copy of a paper titled, "Aromatic Sulfonic Acids as Reagents for Amino Acids."

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 5
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry. Includes Max Bergmann's critques of several papers submitted.

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 6
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry. Includes a copy of a paper titled,"Resolution of dl-Phenylalanine."

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 7
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry. Includes a copy of a paper titled, "Preperation of d(-)- Glutamic Acid from dl-Glutamic Acid by Enzymatic Resolution."

scopecontent.head: Journal of Biological Chemistry, No. 8
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning the submission of papers to the Journal of Biological Chemistry. Includes a copy of a paper titled, "Determination of Proline In Mixtures Containing l- and dl-Proline: The Proline Content of Gelatin."

scopecontent.head: Journals, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Letters to Max Bergmann from the journal "Current Science" requesting a submission by him.

scopecontent.head: Journals, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Advertisements and requests for Max Bergmann to contribute to various journals including: the Journal of the American Chemical Society, Enzymologea, and Biological Abstracts.

scopecontent.head: Journals, No. 3
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning submissions to various journals. Includes Max Bergmann's critques of several papers.

did.unittitle: Journal of the American Leather Chemists Association

scopecontent.head: Journal of the American Leather Chemists Association
scopecontent.p: Letters to Max Bergmann asking for his opinion on several papers submitted for publication. A copy of an address given by Max Bergmann to the American Leather Chemists Association in May 1934.

scopecontent.head: K - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials. Letters of reference from Max Bergmann, requests for chemical samples, and requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: K - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials. Letters requesting reprints and chemicals. Invitation to a groundbreaking ceremony. Letter seeking the advice of Max Bergmann on working with collagen.

scopecontent.head: K - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials. Personal notes. Letters discussing experiments. A copy of a resume for Albert A. Kondritzer. Two letters from October 1947, after Max Bergmann's death, concerning the "latest theories in protein."

scopecontent.head: Kahn, Ernest
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Ernest Kahn concerning employment. Includes letters of reference for Kahn.

scopecontent.head: Kelley, Louise
scopecontent.p: Letters dicussing a paper presented by Max Bergmann at the Richmond Organic Symposium titled, "Protein Structure in Relation to Biological Problems."

scopecontent.head: Kennedy, Norman F.
scopecontent.p: Notice of meeting for the Round Table of Starch Chemists.

scopecontent.head: Kidd, John G.
scopecontent.p: Letter informing Max Bergmann of demonstrations to take place in his lab for the "Third International Congress of Microbiologists" held by the Rockefeller Institute. Note of congratulations to John Kidd on becoming a member of the Institute.

scopecontent.head: King, C. G.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and C. G. King. King recommends a David Glick to Bergmann. Bergmann writes letters of reference for Sam A. Morrell and Carl Nieman for nomination to the American Society of Biological Chemists.

scopecontent.head: Kintzinger, Peter
scopecontent.p: Letter to Max Bergmann seeking advice on job prospects in the United States for a Siegbert Stein, who was interned as a POW in England.

scopecontent.head: Klanfer, Karl
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Karl Klanfer. Letters mainly discuss Klanfer's being interned in a German Jewish internment camp in Canada.

scopecontent.head: Knopf, Martin
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment for Knopf, a German refugee, as an agricultural chemist in the United States. Includes letter of recommendation written by Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Knöpfler, Josef
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Knöpfler concerning job prospects in the United States. Curriculum vitae included.

scopecontent.head: Koch, F. C.
scopecontent.p: A letter inviting Max Bergmann to do a lecture course at the University of Chicago in the summer of 1940. A letter from Max Bergmann introducing Dr. Chi-yuan Chou.

scopecontent.head: Kocholaty, Walter
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning job prospects for Kocholaty. Curriculum vitae included. Requests for chemical samples.

scopecontent.head: Kögl, F.
scopecontent.p: Requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Koenigsberger, Franz
scopecontent.p: Curriculum vitae. Letter from Max Bergmann recommending Dr. Fransisca Stern and Dr. Bruno Rewald.

scopecontent.head: Kohn, Moritz
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the situation of German refugee Moritz Kohn. Bergmann advises Kohn to go to Cuba and then helps him gain entry into the United States. Bergmann also writes to the Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars in an attempt to find work for Kohn. Includes a sample of the 1941 VISA application forms.

scopecontent.head: Kuffner, P. K.
scopecontent.p: A letter of introduction to Max Bergmann from a Dr. Lowenfeld.

scopecontent.head: Kuttner, Ann G.
scopecontent.p: Directions for the preparation of collagen.

scopecontent.head: Kunitz, Moses
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Moses Kunitz. Letters discuss the preparation of chemicals and requests for samples.

scopecontent.head: L - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Letters of reference. Letters of recommendation. Requests for reprints. Requests for chemicals. Notes of thanks. A curriculum vitae for George Laemmle.

scopecontent.head: L - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Notes of thanks. Requests for reprints. A copy of an abstract of a book titled, "Microbiology of Raw Hides." Letters requesting a position working in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: L - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Letters concerning employment in Max Bergmann's lab. Requests for reprints. Personal notes.

scopecontent.head: L - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous materials. Letter of recommendation for Robert Ballentine. Letters of reference. Notes of congratulations. Requests for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Lachow, Ruth
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting a meeting with Max Bergmann. Letters postponing due to Bergmann's illness.

scopecontent.head: Ladenburg, Rudolf
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Rudolf Ladenburg.

scopecontent.head: Lalor Foundation
scopecontent.p: Letters of recommendation for Sidney Fox and Otto K. Behrens.

scopecontent.head: Lamb, Arthur B.
scopecontent.p: Letters asking Max Bergmann to referee two papers for the Journal of the American Chemical Society.

scopecontent.head: Lampen, J. Oliver
scopecontent.p: Requests for chemicals.

scopecontent.head: Landsteiner, Karl
scopecontent.p: Letters exchanging references about chemical reactions and production methods of certain chemicals.

scopecontent.head: Lang, Friedrich
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence. Letters discussing a process which Lang would like to patent.

scopecontent.head: Lange, Willy
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Willy Lange. Bergmann writes Lange asking to help find a job for Dr. Victor Sanders. Lange writes Bergmann seeking recommendations for chemists to work in his lab. Includes the curriculum vitae of Lange.

scopecontent.head: Langmuir, Irving
scopecontent.p: Letters requesting samples. Langmuir forwards a copy of an article by Dorothy Wrinch.

scopecontent.head: Lantern Slides
scopecontent.p: Notes and images from a lecture on December 19, 1941. Includes duplicates of the slides used, two lantern slides, and lecture notes.

scopecontent.head: Lantern Slides: Washington Lecture
scopecontent.p: Lecture notes and images from lantern slides.

scopecontent.head: Laskowski, Michael
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between max Bergmann and Michael Laskowski. Laskowski writes to Bergmann requesting advice and the use of his lab equipment.

scopecontent.head: Leather Samples
scopecontent.p: Physical samples and photographic images of leather.

did.unittitle: Lecture at the Seventh National Organic Chemistry Symposium of the American Chemical Society

scopecontent.head: Lecture at the Seventh National Organic Chemistry Symposium of the American Chemical Society
scopecontent.p: Copy of a lecture given by Max Bergmann titled, "The Structure of Proteins in Relation to Biological Problems."

scopecontent.head: Lectures
scopecontent.p: Notes on various lectures both given and attended.

scopecontent.head: Levene, P. A., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Mrs. P. A. Levene during Bergmann's illness.

scopecontent.head: Levene, P. A., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and P. A. Levene. Levene asks Bergmann to discuss with him and H. T. Clarke the possibility of forming a Committee on Protein ACS. A list of the members of the committee. Letters of opion regarding the committee. Letters of recommendation. Requests fro reprints and chemicals.

scopecontent.head: Levene, P. A., No. 3
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning samples of chemicals from P. A. Levene's collection.

scopecontent.head: Lewis, Howard B.
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss plans for Max Bergmann to give a series of lectures at the Medical School at the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.head: Li, Choh Hao
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning chemical samples from Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Linderstrom-Lang, K.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Linderstrom-Lang. Letters asking Bergmann to contribute to the jubilee volume for the seventieth birthday of Dr. S. P. L. Sorensen. Linderstrom-Lang offers his assistance to Bergmann on his trip to Denmark in March, 1939. Linderstrom-Lang recommends Godfred Haugaard to work in Bergmann's lab. A letter from Bergmann frowarding one of Lindestrom-Lang's papers to the journal of Biological Chemistry.

scopecontent.head: Link, Karl Paul, No. 1
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Karl Paul Link.

scopecontent.head: Link, Karl Paul, No. 2
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Karl Paul Link. Includes letter of recommendation, postcards, invitations, and letters concerning Bergmann's work.

scopecontent.head: Link, Karl Paul, No. 3
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Karl Paul Link. Letters concerning the development of war. Copy of a lecture given by Link in Wisconsin in October, 1936. Recommendations for Carl Niemann to the American Society of Biological Chemists.

scopecontent.head: Link, Karl Paul, No. 4
scopecontent.p: Letter of recommendation and curriculum vitae for David Doherty.

scopecontent.head: Link, Karl Paul, No. 5
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Karl Paul Link.

scopecontent.head: Link, Karl Paul, No. 6
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Karl Paul Link. Letters of recommendation. Invitations. Plans for visits.

scopecontent.head: Lipschitz, Werner
scopecontent.p: Letters from Max Bergmann to Lipschitz giving the advice requested for publishing a paper.

scopecontent.head: Loewenfeld, Philipp
scopecontent.p: Lowenfield writes to Max Bergmann on behalf of Baron Peter Kuffner (German leather chemist) who is looking for a job in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Loewi, Otto
scopecontent.p: Letters from Max Bergmann to Loewi discussing reprints, references, and books. Letter from Bergmann asking Loewi if he is related to a Ludwig Lowy, a refugee that Bergmann is trying to help.

scopecontent.head: Löwy, Ludwig
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning Löwy's attempt to come to the United States.

did.unittitle: Loyalty Committee of Victims of Nazi-Fascist Oppression

scopecontent.head: Loyalty Committee of Victims of Nazi-Fascist Oppression
scopecontent.p: Letters discussing the importance of the organization. Includes letters between Arthur Cohn and Herbert H. Lehman (Governor of New York) illustrating examples of the support the organization is recieving.

scopecontent.head: Lucas, C. C.
scopecontent.p: Requests for reprints. Invitation for Max Bergmann to address the Toronto Chemical Society.

scopecontent.head: Luck, J. Murray, No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Luck. Bergmann writes a letter of recommendation for Dr. Heinz Fraenkal-Conrat.

scopecontent.head: Luck, J. Murray, No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Luck. Discussion about Bergmann's position as a reviewer for the Annual Review of Biochemistry. Arrangements for Bergmann to give a lecture at Harvard University.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence in regards to a talk given by Max Bergmann at the "Seventh National Organic Chemistry Symposium."

scopecontent.head: Siegel, Fritz
scopecontent.p: Siegel writes to Max Bergmann seeking assistance finding employment in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Silk
scopecontent.p: Cross references to other files in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Small, F. H.
scopecontent.p: Small writes to Max Bergmann asking him to review several papers.

scopecontent.head: Small, Lyndon F.
scopecontent.p: Lyndon Small, the chairman for the canvassing committee for the Eli Lilly Award, writes to Max Bergmann for his recommendation of Joseph Fruton to be awarded the prize for 1944.

scopecontent.head: Smith, Edric B., No. 1
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous letters from Edric Smith, business manager at the Rockefeller Institute, in regards to Institute policies and procedures, budgetary concerns, and other general business matters.

scopecontent.head: Smith, Edric B., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous letters from Edric Smith, business manager at the Rockefeller Institute, in regards to Institute policies and procedures, budgetary concerns, and other general business matters.

scopecontent.head: Smith, Edric, No. 3
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous letters from Edric Smith, business manager at the Rockefeller Institute, in regards to Institute policies and procedures, budgetary concerns, and other general business matters.

scopecontent.head: Smith, Emil L., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Emil Smith. Letters regarding a mutual paper to be published.

scopecontent.head: Smith, Emil L., No. 2
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning a volunteer position in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Smithburn, Kenneth C.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence reagarding a "Symposium on Proteins" held at the Rockefeller Institute in February 1938.

scopecontent.head: Societies
scopecontent.p: Invitations and programs for events held by several societies. Also cross references to other files in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Sollner, Karl
scopecontent.p: General correspondence bewteen Max Bergmann and Karl Sollner. Early letters from Sollner requesting Bergmann's help in finding employment. Requests for reprints and chemical samples. Discussion on experiments. Notes of well wishes.

scopecontent.head: Solmssen, Ulrich
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning employment for Ulrich Solmssen. Curriculum vitae included.

scopecontent.head: Soviet Relations
scopecontent.p: Circulars from the National Council of American-Soviet Friendship Inc., the American Council On Soviet Relations, and the Ambijan Committe for Emergency Aid to the Soviet Union. Letters seeking donations from Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Sperry, Warren M.
scopecontent.p: Letters regarding a postition in Max Bergmann's lab for Dr. Heinrich Waelsch. A letter to Sperry asking him to recommend Bergmann, Joseph Fruton, and William Howard Stein for membership in the Biochemical Society.

scopecontent.head: Spiegelberg, Flora
scopecontent.p: Letters discussing the details of a dinner invitation.

scopecontent.head: Spies, Thomas D.
scopecontent.p: Spies writes to Max Bergmann requesting information on Sidney W. Fox.

scopecontent.head: Springer, Julius
scopecontent.p: Orders for books.

scopecontent.head: Squibb, E R & Sons
scopecontent.p: Letters to Max Bergmann requesting a reference for Dr. Gertrude Berend. An invitation to the opening of the Squibb Institute for Medical Research. A letter from Max Bergmann requesting a copy of a bibliography from an article.

scopecontent.head: Sreenivasaya, M.
scopecontent.p: A request for Max Bergmann to be a visiting professor of Biochemistry at the Indian Institute of Science.

scopecontent.head: Staff Meeting
scopecontent.p: Notes from a staff meeting.

scopecontent.head: Stamm, Guido
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning a year long collaboration between Guido Stamm and Max Bergmann at Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Stanley, Wendell M.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Wendell Stanley. Bergmann requests samples of tobacco mosaic virus and other chemicals. Stanley sends a note of congratulations to Bergmann on his appointment to the membership of the Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: G. E. Stechert and Company
scopecontent.p: Book sellers. Book lists for 1944. Orders of catalogs and books. List of second hand books Max Bergmann wishes to sell.

scopecontent.head: Stein, Fred M.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Fred Stein, of the Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars. Stein sends Bergmann the Committees latest report and a list of names that Bergmann might be able to help find work for.

scopecontent.head: Stein, William H., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and William Stein. Several letters discussing different experiments.

scopecontent.head: Stein, William H., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and William Stein. Requests for reprints. Notes on experiments. Requests for chemical samples. Draft of an article by Stein and Bergmann. Office procedures and reprint list compiled by Stein after Bergmann's death.

scopecontent.head: Stein, William H., No. 3
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and William Stein.

scopecontent.head: Steinberg, Robert A.
scopecontent.p: Steinberg writes to Max Bergmann to discuss a technical problem with an experiement.

scopecontent.head: Steinherz, Dezsoe
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning a patent for a particular method.

scopecontent.head: Stern, Dora
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Dora Stern. Letters concerning employment for Stern. Bergmann refers her to the Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars.

scopecontent.head: Stern, Egon
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning employment in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Stern, Karl
scopecontent.p: Letter to the office of Max Bergmann requesting chemical samples. Letter informing Stern of Bergmann's death.

scopecontent.head: Stern, Kurt G.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and Kurt G. Stern. Requests for reprints. Invitation to speak at an enzyme chemistry meeting at Yale.

scopecontent.head: Sternberg, William
scopecontent.p: Arrangements to meet with Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Stewart, Florence M.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the Rockefeller Institute semi-annual reprint list.

scopecontent.head: Stiller, Eric
scopecontent.p: Stiller writes to Max Bergmann concerning several experiments.

scopecontent.head: Stokes, J. L.
scopecontent.p: Letters to Max Bergmann requesting protein samples.

scopecontent.head: Strauss, Edward
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning employment for Edward Strauss. Curriculum vitae included.

scopecontent.head: Strode, George K.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Max Bergmann and George Strode concerning the German development of lousicide.

scopecontent.head: Subscriptions

scopecontent.head: Supplee, G. C.

scopecontent.head: Swift, Homer F.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Homer Swift. Invitations to meetings and dinners.

scopecontent.head: Synthetical Laboratories
scopecontent.p: Requests for chemicals, prices, and quotes.

scopecontent.head: T - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence.

scopecontent.head: T - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence.

scopecontent.head: T - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Tandler, Rudolf
scopecontent.p: Letters discussing employment for Tandler. Includes copies of two papers sent by Tandler to Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: Tanners' Council of America
scopecontent.p: Bulletins for the Tanners' Council of America.

scopecontent.head: Tauber, Henry
scopecontent.p: Requests for reprints from Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association
scopecontent.p: Literature from the Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association.

scopecontent.head: Telegrams
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous telegrams.

scopecontent.head: Teutsch, Ilse

scopecontent.head: Thannhauser, S. J.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Thannhauser. Thannhauser asks Bergmann's advice on an experiment. Bergmann recommends chemists to work in Thannhauser's lab.

scopecontent.head: Thomas, Lloyd E.
scopecontent.p: Requests for chemicals from Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Tietzman, Josephine
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence between Max Bergmann and Josephine Tietzman. Includes a letter of recommendation written by Bergmann for Tietzman.

scopecontent.head: U - Misc.
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Uber, Fred M.
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Fred Uber. Exchange of chemicals and reprints. Uber writes seeking information on Hermann Barschall. Bergmann recommends Walter Marx and H. M. Evans to work in Uber's lab.

scopecontent.head: Unemployed Scientists
scopecontent.p: A list of unemployed scientists, mostly refugees.

scopecontent.head: United China Relief
scopecontent.p: Circulars, newspapers, and requests for donations.

scopecontent.head: United States
scopecontent.p: Notices of government jobs.

scopecontent.head: Universities
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence between Max Bergmann and officials from several different universities. Includes letters of reference and recommendation written by Max Bergmann.

scopecontent.head: University of Michigan
scopecontent.p: A series of four lectures given by Max Bergmann at the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.head: Urey, Harold C.
scopecontent.p: Max Bergmann writes to Urey requestiong information regarding Saul Soloway.

scopecontent.head: V - Misc.
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Van Slyke, Donald D., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Donald Van Slyke. Notes of congratulations to Bergmann for winning the Phillip A. Conne Gold Medal in 1936. Requests and thanks for reprints.

scopecontent.head: Van Slyke, Donald D., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Donald Van Slyke. Requests for reprints. Dinner invitations. Notes of congratulations. Van Slyke writes to Bergmann wanting donations for the Committee for Medical Aid to China.

scopecontent.head: Van Slyke Apparatus
scopecontent.p: A series of charts for use with the apparatus.

scopecontent.head: Vickery, Hubert, No. 1

scopecontent.head: Viobin Corporation
scopecontent.p: Circulars conataining examples of Viobin corn products.

scopecontent.head: Visitors

scopecontent.head: Voegelin, Charles
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning references for a postion in Voegelin's lab.

scopecontent.head: Von Der Osten, Anna L.
scopecontent.p: Letters asking for the names and addresses of all the scientific staff working in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: Von Gutfeld, Fritz
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and Fritz Von Gutfield.

scopecontent.head: Vonk, H. J.
scopecontent.p: Requests for chemical samples.

scopecontent.head: W - Misc., No. 1
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence. Exchange of reprints. Requests for chemical samples. Personal letters.

scopecontent.head: W - Misc., No. 2
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence. Requests for reprints. Letters of recommendation. Correpondence concerning employment in Max Bergmann's lab.

scopecontent.head: W - Misc., No. 3
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence. Requests for chemical samples. Letters of introduction. Letters concerning experiments.

scopecontent.head: W - Misc., No. 4
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence. Requests for reprints. Invitations to speaking engagements. Letters of recommendation.

scopecontent.head: W - Misc., No. 5
scopecontent.p: General miscellaneous correspondence. Letters concerning employment for organic chemists. Exchange of reprints.

scopecontent.head: Waelsch, Heinrich
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning employment for Heinrich Waelsch. Curriculum vitae and publications list included.

scopecontent.head: Wagreich, Harry

Exchange of reprints. Wagreich expresses his interest in collaborating with Bergmann on National Defense Research Projects.

scopecontent.head: Waksman, Selman A.
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning a job in the United States for Carl Neuberg.

scopecontent.head: Wallerstein, Leo, No. 1

scopecontent.head: Wallerstein, Leo, No. 2

scopecontent.head: Wallerstein Laboratory No. 1
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and the Wallerstein Laboratory. Communication is mainly between Bergmann and Leo Wallerstein. Discussion of refugee scientists, reprints, copies of lectures, and requests for chemicals and apparatus.

scopecontent.head: Wallerstein Laboratory No. 2
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and the Wallerstein Laboratory. Communication is mainly between Bergmann and Leo Wallerstein. Discussion of refugee scientists, reprints, copies of lectures, and requests for chemicals and apparatus.

scopecontent.head: Wallerstein Laboratory No. 3
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and the Wallerstein Laboratory. Communication is mainly between Bergmann and Leo Wallerstein. Exchange of reprints. Letters concerning experiments. Requests for chemical samples.

scopecontent.head: Wallerstein Laboratory No. 4
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Max Bergmann and the Wallerstein Laboratory. Communication is mainly between Bergmann and Leo Wallerstein. Discussion of refugee scientists, reprints, copies of lectures, and requests for chemicals and apparatus.

scopecontent.head: Walter, George
scopecontent.p: Curriculum vitae and letters of recommendation.

scopecontent.head: Walti, Alphonse

scopecontent.head: Wassermann, Michael
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning employment for Wassermann.
